member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QCompositeItemBase.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.summary: Contains the item that is the last created clone of this item. You can reset (and therby unlinking) this item by calling RemoveCloneLink on this item.
member.remarks: When this is set, and an event is raised on the cloned item, the event is also raised on this item

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QCompositeItemBase.OriginalItem
member.summary: If this is a cloned item, this propery contains the original item. You can reset (and thereby unlinking) this item by calling RemoveCloneLink on the original item.
member.remarks: When this is set, the events on the Original item are also raised.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QFastPropertyBagHost.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.Ribbon.QRibbon
member.summary: this class implements the Ribbon Control like the one used in the Microsoft Office 2007 applications.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QTabControl
member.summary: QTabControl allows you to present tabs in several ways. At top, bottom, left or right. It uses instances of to display the tabpage. It contains four instances, for every side one. To configure the instances use , , etc.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControl
member.summary:
This is a base implementation for a container controls that needs or implementations. It extends the class. You can specify the colors for this control by overriding the , the and the and returning a valid property name from the . It is also possible to paint the complete control yourself. See for details the type.
It also contains the possibility to inherit the default Windows font by specifying the . You can define the position of the background image by setting property.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase
member.summary:
QContainerControlBase makes it possible to create container controls that have its own NonClientArea defined. This is done by implementing the , , etc. properties and returning the correct margin for each side. With this control you can create container controls that have their own borders, captions or other elements that should be drawn outside the ClientRectangle. You can define your own painting code for the NonClientArea by overriding the method or by handling the event.
It is also possible to let the control get sized by the user when the user clicks on the borders. This is done by setting the correct value for the , etc. properties. Make sure you also implement the if you want to let the user to resize the control. This is the width of the border the user can press on to resize.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.#ctor
member.summary: Default Constructor

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window)
member.summary: Creates a QContainerControlBase with a possible Owner. This can be handy for ToolWindows. It shouldn't be used when the control is parented.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.Initialize
member.summary: Obsolete since version 1.0.7.20. If you have overridden this method, put the code in the Constructor of your control QContainerControlBase override.

member.summary: Sets extra for this control. Value indicates whether the styles must be set.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.SetOwnerWindow(System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the owner window. If force is true it is always set, no matter whether the current owner window is the same.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.SetOwnerWindowCore
member.summary: Takes default actions when the owner window is changed.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.StartTimer(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts a timer with the specified timerId to the specified interval for this Control. When the timer elapses the event is raised with the specified timerId. To change the interval of a timer call this method again with the same timerId. You set several timers with different timerIds. The timerIds only have to be unique for this Control
member.remarks: Make sure you start your TimerIds from 1024, under 1024 are used for internal purposes

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.StopTimer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stops the timer that was set with

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.RefreshNoClientArea(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Redraws the NoClientArea. refreshChildren indicates if the NoClientArea of the children should also be refreshed.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.RefreshNoClientArea
member.summary: Redraws the NonClientArea. It does not refresh the NonClientArea of the children.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.PerformNonClientAreaLayout
member.summary: Performs the layout of the NoClientArea. This method should be called when some of the ClientAreaMargin properties change and the changes should be reflected.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.PerformNonClientAreaLayout(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs the layout of the NonClientArea. This method should be called when the some of the ClientAreaMargin properties change and the changes should be reflected.
member.param: Indicates if the Child controls of this Control should also perform NonClientArea Layout

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.PointToControl(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Calculates the actual point on the control from the Point in ClientCoordinates. Use this method to determine where the Cursor is above the non client areas.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.NonClientRectangleToClient(System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Calculates the NonClientRectangle to a ClientRectangle.

member.summary: This event gets raised when the user releases the button on the NonClientArea and the specified area is known. Like on the Caption or on the Sizing area.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContainerControlBase.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPersistableObject
member.summary: Defines the interface that is implemented by the Controls and objects that can load and save their persistableObject state to a file.
member.remarks: Because some Controls like QToolBars can be moved and docked by the user, you can persist that information to a file or database via the QPersistenceManager. This enables the the user to open the Application the same way as they have closed it. Instances of IQPersistableObject are the objects that contain information that needs to be persisted like position, size, etc. See the overview of for details on persistence.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPersistableObject.MustBePersistedAfter(Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPersistableObject)
member.summary: Because persistableObjects are saved in a specific order and loaded in the saved order, this function returns whether a persistableObject must be saved after some other persistableObject. This can be used when persisting arrays of items where the order of loading matters. Return false when it doesn't matter in which order it is persisted.
member.returns: True when the object must be persisted after the specified persistableObject, else false.
member.remarks: When 2 persistableObjects return true on each other (so they both must be persisted after each other) or via other persistableObjects (a loop) a stackoverflow can occur during the SavePersistableObjects method.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPersistableObject.SavePersistableObject(Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPersistenceManager,System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable)
member.summary: Saves the persistableObject as a childNode of the specified parentElement
member.param: Contains the manager where the PersistableObjects and PersistableHosts can be found.

Contains the element where the persistableObject must save is state under. The persistableObject must save its state as a child element under the parentElement. You can use to create the appropiate child element.
member.returns: The XmlElement that contains the persistableObject. This can be null if nothing had to be persisted.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPersistableObject.LoadPersistableObject(Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPersistenceManager,System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable,System.Object)
member.summary: Loads the persistableObject from the specified persistableObjectElement
member.param: The manager where the PersistableObjects and PersistableHosts can be found
The XmlElement that describes the persistableObject.
When a persistableObject loads child persistableObjects itself, it can use the parentState to provide the childs with additional information.
member.returns: True if the persistableObject is succesfully loaded, else false

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPersistableObject.UnloadPersistableObject
member.summary: Unloads a persistableObject. This is often called before re-loading the persistableObjects

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPersistableObject.PersistGuid
member.summary: Contains a unique identifier to identify the PersistableObject object with.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPersistableObject.PersistObject
member.summary: Indicates whether this IQPersistableObject should be persisted when it is in the collection and is called.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPersistableObject.IsPersisted
member.summary: Defines a state boolean that indicates if the object is already persisted.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPersistableObject.RequiresUnload
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this control requires an unload before loading from a persistableObjectElement.

member.summary: Indicates that a new instance of this PersistableObject must be created when it is loaded from file. If this is false the persistableObject must match an existing persistableObject in the collection.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QTabControl.BeginInit
member.summary: Begins the initialize procedure.
member.remarks:
When initializing the property is not changed when it is not -1 and added to a collection, else it is possible that the ButtonOrder of tabbuttons are increased.
Next to that you can set the property while it the QTabPage is not added to the Controls collection yet. Besure that you add the ActiveTabPage to the Controls collection before calling EndInit().

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QTabControl.EndInit
member.summary: Ends the initialize procedure.
member.remarks:
When initializing the property is not changed when it is not -1 and added to a collection, else it is possible that the ButtonOrder of tabbuttons are increased.
Next to that you can set the property while it the QTabPage is not added to the Controls collection yet. Besure that you add the ActiveTabPage to the Controls collection before calling EndInit().

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QTranslucentWindow.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.summary: QMarkupTextElement defines the base class for elements visible in . This QMarkupText object is used by for example to show formatted text.
member.remarks: a QMarkupTextElement is generally created by a when it is parsing the markup text. It parses an XML Node and creates the correct QMarkupTextElement for that node. You can implement your own QMarkTextElement objects and styles. See for additional information how to do this.

member.summary: Returns the next textPart that fits inside maximumWidth from startIndex
member.param: The text to get the part from
The index to start at, After this method the startIndex contains a new startIndex.
Contains the textParams used to render
Contains the maximum width the text can have.
Indicates that no starting space should be included
Out. Contains the textSize of the part that is returned.
Contains the widths of the textPart for every character.
member.returns: The part from startIndex when found. When there are no characters left to parse it returns null. If no word fits in the current width it returns an Empty string.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QMarkupText
member.summary: The QMarkupText object is used by and to show formatted text. For this purpose it implements a small subset of HTML. This should be written in legal XML. So when formatting, be sure to end empty tags like 'BR' with a slash like this is done in XML. Next to formatting you can make the QMarkupText interactive by using anchors.
member.remarks:
To see the tags that can be used in QMarkupText, see the QMarkupText XML Reference.
You can implement your own elements or styles to use with the QMarkupText. To do this, do the following:
inherit a class from . This class is responsible for creating the element.
Inherit if needed a a class from and return a new instance of this element in the method or set the to the type of this element.
Implement the required methods like , or .
Add an instance of your new created style to the collection.

member.summary: When the state of the QAppStateIndicatorItem is greater than zero then use just one 1 the MainState.

member.name: F:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QAppStateIndicatorType.AllInMain
member.summary: When the state of the QAppStateIndicatorItem is greater than zero then add the current value of that state in the MainState.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QAppStateIndicator
member.summary: The QAppStateIndicator makes it possible to create a stack of different application states. This stack can be increased or decreased with different descriptions, this way the user always sees what the application is doing. The QAppStateIndicator works together with the and the . Set the to a Panel or other container control if the StateImages should be displayed. A has a that is a sum of all the states of the items. The value of the MainState is expressed in the QProgressBar

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QTabPage
member.summary: QTabPage represents one tab and control on a .
member.remarks:
QTabPages uses an instance of to represent the tab. You can use to configure the way QTabButtons look on the complete strip. To override these settings on a single QTabPage, you can use
Use to define the index where the QTabPage should be displayed. Use to indicate if the button should be located top / left / right or bottom.
For the colors of the tabs it first looks if the of the QTabPage has a color defined. That is, that it does not contain a default value (it is bold). If it does contain a default value, it uses the Color from the parenting . This way you can define the QTabPage colors on QTabControl level.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlComponent.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControl.StartTimer(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts a timer with the specified timerId to the specified interval for this Control. When the timer elapses the event is raised with the specified timerId. To change the interval of a timer call this method again with the same timerId. You set several timers with different timerIds. The timerIds only have to be unique for this Control
member.remarks: Make sure you start your TimerIds from 1024, under 1024 are used for internal purposes

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControl.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QComposite.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QToolBarHost
member.summary: The QToolBarHost is used to host one or more instances or a .

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPersistableHost
member.summary: Defines the interface that is implemented by controls that can host IQPersistableObject objects.
member.remarks:
Because some Controls like QToolBars can be moved and docked by the user, you can persist that information to a file or database via the QPersistenceManager. This enables the the user to open the Application the same way as they have closed it. IQPersistableHosts are Controls that are solid in the application. PersistableObjects can refer to those hosts to define where they are located in the application. Examples of IQPersistableHosts are and .
See the overview of for details on persistence.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QTabStripNavigationArea.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QStatusBar
member.summary:
The QStatusBar can be used to give the user information about the status of the application. It can be completely configured with colors and styles. It implements a and a property.
Use the property to define the contents of the QStatusBar. You can use the class to add custom controls to the QStatusBar.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QProgressBar
member.summary: The QProgressBar is capable of showing progress in horizontal and vertical direction. It can do this in different colors and styles. It contains a and a to define the colors and layout of the QProgressBar. It can show progress in several blocks or as one block. It is possible to move from the minimum value to the maximum value and the other way around.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlPaint
member.summary: Contains static helper methods to draw elements of controls and convert images. When images are converted they are added to the for performance-upgrade. When the method is called again with the same parameters the image from the cache is returned.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlPaint.ConvertIconToBitmap(System.Drawing.Icon)
member.summary: Converts the Icon to a bitmap and preserves the Alpha channel.
member.remarks: When an Icon contains translucent pixels (with alpha channel) this information is ignored with the default Icon.ToBitmap() method. This results that the translucent pixels are 100% visible. This method converts the icon to a Bitmap and keeps the alpha information.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlPaint.DrawIcon(System.Drawing.Icon,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Draws the Icon while preserving Alpha information.
member.remarks: When an Icon contains translucent pixels (with alpha channel) this information is ignored with the default graphics.DrawIcon on Windows 2000 and on Windows XP on a layered window. This results that the translucent pixels are 100% visible. This method converts the icon to a Bitmap (or gets it from the cache) and keeps the alpha information.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlPaint.DrawIcon(System.Drawing.Icon,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Draws the Icon while preserving Alpha information.
member.remarks: When an Icon contains translucent pixels (with alpha channel) this information is ignored with the default graphics.DrawIcon on Windows 2000 and on Windows XP on a layered window. This results that the translucent pixels are 100% visible. This method converts the icon to a Bitmap (or gets it from the cache) and keeps the alpha information.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlPaint.DrawIcon(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Icon,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Draws an Icon with the colors replaced with replaceColorWith. When replaceColor is empty, no colors are replaced.
member.param: the graphics to draw on.
The Icon to draw.
Contains a color to replace. There is no color replaced when this is empty
Contains the color to replace the replaceColor with.
The Rectangle to draw the icon into.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlPaint.DrawIconDisabled(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Icon,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Draws an Icon disabled on graphics in the requested size.
member.param: The graphics to draw on
The icon to draw
The rectangle to draw the icon on. The size of the rectangle determines which icon is drawn

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlPaint.DrawImage(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Draws an image with the colors replaced with replaceColorWith. When replaceColor is empty, no colors are replaced.
member.param: The graphics to draw on.
The image to draw.
Contains a color to replace. There is no color replaced when this is empty.
Contains the color to replace the replaceColor with.
the Rectangle to draw the image into

member.summary: Draws a disabled image on graphics in the specified rectangle.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QGlobalColorScheme
member.summary: This class defines the global . This scheme is used by all controls that don't have their own colors defined. It contains a property that indicates if the CurrentTheme should be inherited from Windows.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QColorScheme
member.summary: The QColorScheme class is used by all the Qios.DevSuite.Components controls to indicate what color to use. A QColorScheme can contain colors for various themes. You can add or remove themes by setting the property. You can indicate whether to inherit the current theme from the theme by setting .

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QColorSchemeBase.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target Alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLinearLayoutEngine.AdjustContentSizeForPartCalculation(Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartDirection,System.Drawing.Size,System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: This method adjusts the specified contentSize. This is basically used in and can be overridden by layout engines to change the behavior.
member.param: The direction in which is calculated
The contentSize that is being adjusted
The size of the part where the contentsize is adjusted with.
member.returns: the new ContentSize for the parentPart
member.remarks: The default behavior adds the width of contentPartSize to the contentSize and sets the height of the contentSize to maximum between the height of the contentSize and the contentPartSize. This ofcourse when parentPart is horizontal, when vertical the process is inverted.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target Alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QCompositeControl.PaintTransparentBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a transparent background must be painted. When this is false the background color of the parent is painted on this Control. This can increase performance. Set this to false when the Control is situated on a Parent with a solid background or when the control has a rectangular filled out shape

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QCompositeControl.HasSimulatedFocus
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this control must take over the outersize of the calculated composite. Besides that, when this is set, the contents of the composite uses all the space it needs. The composite itself shrinks or stretches when needed and is allowed to.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QFastPropertyBag
member.summary: Defines a propertyBag that is faster than . It uses an integer based array instead of a HashTable. It is used by several classes to store properties and their default values in. It uses to retrieve the base value from if the value for this bag is not set.
member.remarks: Besure to cal

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QFastPropertyBag.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new PropertyCollection with the specified size. The size is not changed when needed anymore.

member.summary: Suspends any change notification. Now no redraw or layout will occur. It returns howmay times it is suspended.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QFastPropertyBag.ResumeChangeNotification(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resumes any layout notification suspended by . It returns howmay times it is suspended.

member.summary: Defines a property with the specified value and default value.
member.param: Contains the index of the property. If the index already exists the property gets overridden.
Contains the value of the property. If this is null the base Property is returned. If there is no base Property, the defaultValue is returned.
Contains the defaultValue of this property

Indicates whether this property must return the base Property when null (if there is a base Property ofcourse). Default this is true. When it is false or there are no base Properties the defaultValue is returned.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QFastPropertyBag.DefineProperty(System.Int32,System.Object,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Defines a property with the specified value and default value.
member.param: Contains the index of the property. If the index already exists the property gets overridden.
Contains the value of the property. If this is null the base Property is returned. If there is no base Property, the defaultValue is returned.
Contains the defaultValue of this property
Indicates whether the value must be replaced with the property already exists
Indicates whether the default value must be replaced with the property already exists

Indicates whether this property must return the base Property when null (if there is a base Property ofcourse). Default this is true. When it is false or there are no base Properties the defaultValue is returned.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QFastPropertyBag.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target Alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.summary: Scroll till the specified x coordinate is in the view or with the relative x amount. This can happen animated or not.
member.param: The x value, how this value is interpretered is defined by the method.

Defines the method to scroll. This can be IntoView or relative. When IntoView, the xValue must contain the unscrolled value to scroll to. Otherwise xValue defines the relative amount (step) to scroll. This can be positive or negative.
Indicates whether animation should be used

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QScrollablePartData.ScrollVertical(System.Int32,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QScrollablePartMethod,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Scroll till the specified y coordinate is in the view or with the relative y amount. This can happen animated or not.
member.param: The y value, how this value is interpretered is defined by the method.

Defines the method to scroll. This can be IntoView or relative. When IntoView, the yValue will be scrolled in to the view. Otherwise yValue defines the relative amount (step) to scroll. This can be positive or negative.
Indicates whether animation should be used

member.name: E:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QInputBox.NonClientAreaMouseUp
member.summary: This event gets raised when the user releases the button on the NonClientArea and the specified area is known. Like on the Caption or on the Sizing area.
member.remarks: You need to cancel the DefaultAction on the NonClientAreaMouseDown event if you want to handle this event. Otherwise the default action is done and there is no control over it anymore.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QInputBox.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the SelectedItem in the Items collection This property only has effect when the QInputBox is configured as a DropDown, DropDownList or TextBox control.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QInputBox.SelectedItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected item. This item must be contained in the Item collection. This property only has effect when the QInputBox is configured as a DropDown, DropDownList or TextBox control.

member.summary: Gets whether this box is hot.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QInputBox.PaintTransparentBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a transparent background must be painted. When this is false the background color of the parent is painted on this Control. This can increase performance. Set this to false when the Control is situated on a Parent with a solid background or when the control has a rectangular filled out shape

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QInputBox.Items
member.summary: Gets an object representing the collection of the items contained in this QInputBox. This property only has effect when the QInputBox is configured as a DropDown, DropDownList or TextBox control. When the QInputBox is databound the Items collection is locked.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QInputBox.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QBalloon
member.summary: A QBalloon is a component that can contain listeners with descriptive text for controls. The QBalloon will show a QBalloonWindow with the provided markup text when the target control contains the focus or when the user hovers above it with the mouse. The QBalloon showing and hiding process can be configured to apply animations and delays. The QBalloonWindow is a QShapedWindow (a rectangle shape by default) and its shape can be configured. To configure the shape of the QBalloonWindow, set the BalloonWindowClassReference, BalloonWindow or BalloonWindowShape property of the Configuration object.
member.remarks:
To configure the markup text for controls use the , and methods. The methods and allows you to format your text. To see the tags that can be used for this formatting, see the QMarkupText XML Reference.
To handle mouse events, implement an event handler for the several events like or .

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPropertyBagHost.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QTabStrip.StartScrolling(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts a scroll animation till the specified point is visible. Whether tillPointVisible indicates an X or an Y depends on the dockStyle of the tabStrip. when tillPointVisible is 0, then it scrolls to the most left, when tillPointVisible is (Width or Height depending on the Dock property) then it scrolls to the most right.

member.summary: Stops the scrolling process.

member.summary: Returns the accessible TabButton (enabled and visible) at the specified controlPoint. If there is no TabButton at that point it returns null. the controlPoint must be in the coordinates of the parenting control.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QTabStrip.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QCommandConfiguration.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPropertyBag.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target Alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.summary: Defines a helper class for laying out QParts.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutHelper.PrepareForStretchShrink(Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPart,Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPartCollection,System.Drawing.Size,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartDirection,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutContext)
member.summary: Prepares the collection for stretching / shrinking. Returns a storage containing totals.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutHelper.SaveSizeBeforeConstraints(Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPartCollection)
member.summary: Saves all the sizes before constraints in the engine state properties.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutHelper.ReapplyConstraintsRequired(Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPartCollection,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartDirection,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutContext,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartApplyConstraintProperties)
member.summary: Checks whether contraints must be reapplied.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutHelper.AssertApplyConstraintsLoopCount(System.Int32@,Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPart)
member.summary: Because ApplyConstraints are potentially infinite loops, this method makes sure the app crashes when the loop comes over a 100 count. Normally the loop has to run once for a regular linear layout. It may run twice for flow layouts or automatic scroll layouts, and it may run 3 times for automatic scroll on a flow layout.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutHelper.AddAdditionalRowSizesToStretchShringStorage(Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartStretchStorage,Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPart,Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPartCollection,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartDirection)
member.summary: If a table contains rows with various column counts, the rows containing cells that can stretch shrink should take possible additional sizes into account. This method adds those sizes.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutHelper.CalculatePossibleMaxTableRowsAndCells(Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPart,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutContext,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutStage)
member.summary: This method calculates possible table cell sizes in a a QPartLayoutStorage. This is called by several methods in the LayoutEngines while calculating their sizes.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutHelper.ApplyShrinkInDirection(System.Drawing.Size,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartDirection,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutContext,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartStretchStorage)
member.summary: Applies shrink to the items in the collection. After this is called constraints must be applied to every part to make sure the childs can adjust to the shrink.
member.returns: Returns whether some shrinking is done. If no shrinking is done it might need some stretching
member.remarks: The shrink behavior is different then the stretch behavior. When shrinking, all the big parts are shrinked till all the parts are the same size. Then they are shrunken equally. When stretching, the additional space is added to the stretched parts equally.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutHelper.ApplyStretchInDirection(System.Drawing.Size,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartDirection,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartLayoutContext,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPartStretchStorage)
member.summary: Applies stretch to the items in the collection. After this is called constraints must be applied to every part to make sure the childs can adjust to the stretch.
member.returns: Returns whether some stretching is done. If no stretching is done it might need shrinking
member.remarks: The shrink behavior is different then the stretch behavior. When shrinking, all the big parts are shrinked till all the parts are the same size. Then they are shrunken equally. When growing, the additional space is added to the stretched parts equally.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.summary: Docks the ToolBar on the specified host, row and index.
member.param: Specifies the toolBarHost where the toolBar must be docked on.
Specifies the row where the toolBar must be docked on. The first row has index 0.
Specifies what index the toolBar must have on the row. The first toolBar has index 0.
member.remarks: When this method is called, the requestedPosition is resetted to 0. Use another overload to specify the requestedPosition

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QToolBar.DockToolBar(Qios.DevSuite.Components.QToolBarHost,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Docks the ToolBar on the specified host, row and index and the requestedPosition.
member.param: Specifies the toolBarHost where the toolBar must be docked on.
Specifies the row where the toolBar must be docked on. The first row has index 0.
Specifies what index the toolBar must have on the row. The first toolBar has index 0.
Specifies what the left (horizontal) or top (vertical) must be. The toolBar will get that position when there are no other toolBars on that posisition.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QMenuItem
member.summary:
The QMenuItem class represents a menu item on a . It can contain a to represent text or an to show an icon. To use a different icon when the QMenuItem is checked use the .
Set the property to true to define the QMenuItem as a separator.
A QMenuItem can be activated by the mouse, a or a .
The system also supports personalization. Set the to false to make sure a QMenuItem is not drawn when a QMenu is personalized.
Because applications often have a system with rights that determine if a user is allowed to do something, a QMenuItem contains a property. With this property it is possible to disable or hide the QMenuItem when the user is not allowed to execute the item. Use the to indicate if the MenuItem should be hidden or disabled.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QCommand.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

When changing the orientation to VerticalDown or VerticalUp, then the spacings, paddings, sizes, contentOrder and contentAlignments change with it. For example, setting the orientation to VerticalDown then the top padding is displayed on the right (the top of the text).

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QTabButton
member.summary: A QTabButton defines one button on a . It is used by to show its tabbutton.
member.remarks:
It is not possible to create QTabButtons manually, this is done automatically while creating a .
A QTabButton can be located top / left / bottom or right. The content can be drawn horizontal, verticalUp or verticalDown. To configure the appearance of a QTabButton, use . This can also be accessed via or .

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPersistenceManager
member.summary: Manages the persistableObject configuration of instances like QDockingWindows, QMenu's and QToolBars to and from files.
member.remarks:
Because some Controls like QToolBars can be moved and docked by the user, you can persist that information to a file or database via the QPersistenceManager. This enables the the user to open the Application the same way as they have closed it. The QPersistenceManager works with two types of objects: The ones that implement and the ones that implement . Instances of IQPersistableObject are the objects that contain information that needs to be persisted like position, size, etc. IQPersistableHosts are Controls that are solid in the application. PersistableObjects can refer to those hosts to define where they are located in the application. Examples of IQPersistableHosts are and .
The QPersistenceManager contains two collections: and . When you call all the persistableObjects in the PersistableObjects collection will be saved. If a PersistableObject needs a host to refer to then it tries to find that host in the PersistableHosts collection.
PersistableObjects and PersistableHosts are identified by their and . When a persistableObject is saved the persistGuid of that persistableObject is written to the file. When the file is loaded again via the method then the PersistGuid of the persistableObjects in the file are matched to ones in the PersistableObjects collection. When a match is found that specific persistableObject gets loaded. Because of this it is important that the PersistGuids of specific persistableObjects and hosts are always the same in every run of the application.
Because the QPersistenceManager saves the persistableObjects from its PersistableObjects collection and uses that same collection to match the objects during a load, the PersistableObjects and PersistableHosts collections must be initialized before Load or Save is called. You can do this 2 ways: Call , this clears the collections and iterates through every Control on the . If the Control implements IQpersistableObject or IQPersistableHost, it gets added to one of the collections. You can also choose not to call InitializeFromOwner and maintain the collections yourself.
Next to the possibility to match the Perstables by their PersistGuid, you can also let a persistableObject be created from scratch when it gets loaded. This is done by setting the . When this is set and the PersistableObject gets loaded, a new instance of the type of the PersistableObject is created. This can be usefull when you do not have one or a static number of instances of a specified persistableObject, but a variable number of instances.
To influence the load and save of persistableObjects, the QPersistenceManager has a set of events. If for example a persistableObject from the file is not supposed to be created and it is not in the collection, the is called. During this event you can manually provide the QPersistenceManager with the persistableObject by setting . This can be usefull if you do not want to create all the persistableObjects prior calling . The same thing can be done for PersistableHosts via .
When a PersistableObject has set to true, and it gets created, the event is called. During this event you can set additional properties or attach eventhandlers to the PersistableObject.
After a PersistableObject is loaded, the event is called. This event comes with a . This contains the actual XML element the persistableObject is loaded from. You can use this event to load additional properties that you have saved with the persistableObject during the event.
As mentioned, when a PersistableObject gets saved, the event is called. This event can be used to save additional properties with the specified PersistableObject. The is set to the created XML Element during this event. You can add additional XML to this element during this event.
If you want, you can create your own persistableObjects by implementing the interface. This way This way you can persist and load your own objects the same way as the various Qios.DevSuite Controls.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPersistenceManager.GetPersistableHost(System.Guid,Qios.DevSuite.Components.IQPersistableObject)
member.summary: Tries to find the persistableHost based on the persistableHostGuid.
member.param: Contains the Guid of the host requested.
Specified information of the persistableObject that is requesting the host. This information is used during the event. Can be null.
member.returns: A persistableHost based on the guid when createNew is not set.
member.remarks: It tries to find the persistableHost in the collection by its Guid. When it is not there it fires the event.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPersistenceManager.GetPersistableObject(System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable)
member.summary: Tries to create or find the persistableObject based on the persistableObjectElement.
member.param: An XML Element that specifies that contains whether it must be created, the guid, name and type of the persistableObject. The format of the XML Element must be the same as returned by .
member.returns: A new created persistableObject (if createNew is true) or a persistableObject based on the guid when createNew is not set.
member.remarks: When the persistableObject is specified by its Guid and must not be created, it tries to find the persistableObject in the collection by its Guid. When it is not there it fires the event. On a succesfull creation of a new persistableObject it raises the event.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPersistenceManager.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QCommandCollection.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QTranslucentWindowComponent
member.summary: A component to configure and create QTranslucentWindows in the designer. Use the Configuration property to configure the QTranslucentWindow and call the Show or ShowCenteredOnScreen method to create and show the QTranslucentWindow. It is also possible to use the QTranslucentWindow without this component.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QDockContainer
member.summary:
The QDockContainer makes it possible to dock several objects. next to each other or on each other with a tabstrip. When a QDockingWindow gets docked, it will always be docked on a QDockContainer. When an other QDockingWindow docks on the QDockingWindow it will be docked on the same QDockContainer if the orientation is the same, else a new QDockContainer will be created.
Normally you don't have to wonder about QDockContainer, those objects are managed automatically. use instead.

member.name: F:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QFloatingMenuShortcutLayout.InSeparateColumn

member.name: F:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QFloatingMenuShortcutLayout.InTitleColumn
member.summary: Indicates that the shortcut is written in the title column. This saves space. When you have for example an item with the name Long Text Item and you have an item Short with a shortcut Ctrl+K, the Ctrl+K will overlap the text Long Text Item

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlStyles
member.summary: Is used by controls to set additional flags for the behavior of controls. Use this enumeration to set appropiate flags for the controls that have the SetQControlStyle method like .

member.name: F:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlStyles.None
member.summary: No styles defined.

member.name: F:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlStyles.DoNotCopyBitsOnUserSize
member.summary: Does not copy the bits when the user sizes. This flag is usefull when you paint right aligned.

member.name: F:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlStyles.DoNotNotifyChangeOnUserSize
member.summary: Does not notify the other Controls of the userSize. This increases performance. Make sure you repaint a possible parent control in the UserSized event.

member.name: F:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlStyles.DoNotRedrawOnUserSize
member.summary: Does not redraw the control on the UserSize. This increases performance. Make sure you repaint the control and the underlying controls in the UserSized event.

member.name: F:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlStyles.DoNothingOnUserSize
member.summary: Combination of DoNotCopyBitsOnUserSize, DoNotNotifyChangeOnUserSize and DoNotRedrawOnUserSize flag. This flag indicates that the control is not redrawn, bits are not copied and other controls are not notified when the user sizes the the Control. This can increase performance when you want to recalculate the layout of the ChildControls when the user resizes the control. When you set this style be sure to redraw the Control in the UserSized event and repaint possible parent controls.

member.name: F:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlStyles.NeverCopyBitsOnBoundsChange
member.summary: Indicates that bits should never be copied when the bounds change.

member.name: F:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlStyles.NeverRedrawOnBoundsChange
member.summary: Indicates that there should be never redrawn on a bounds change

member.name: F:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QControlStyles.DoNotInvalidateOnScroll
member.summary: Does not invalidate the control when the user scrolls.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.Ribbon.QRibbonForm.AppearanceSimple
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Simple appearance must be used. When this is true, no advanced gradients are drawn. Just a plain background color and a plain border. Keep this true for increased resizing performance.
member.remarks: This property is there because a Form is usually filled with other controls. Therefore it is pointless to draw advanced gradients. The resizing features of the Form increase significantly when this is true.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.Ribbon.QRibbonForm.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QShape
member.summary: The QShape class is used to define custom shapes for controls. It contains lines and beziers. This is used for example to draw the for a
member.remarks:
a QShape has several instances. Every item is a Point or a Bezier. Combined they are the shape. To specify how a point should behave when the QShape is sized, you can set . When an anchor for example is set to Top and Left, the Point will always be absolute positioned relative to the top-left corner.
To define where the content of a shape goes, you must use . For a for example this defines where the text and icon go.

member.name: P:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QShape.WeakEventHandlers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the EventHandlers must contain a WeakReference to the Target. WeakReferences make sure that the Target gets collected by the GC if the refence of the EventHandler is the only reference to the Target. Only set this to false when the reference to the Target is the only reference alive and you want to keep the Target Alive.
member.remarks: You need to re-assign the EventHandlers if you change this property.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QExplorerBar
member.summary: A QExplorerBar can be used to present grouped buttons to the user for easy access to the most used functionality. The buttons of a QExplorerBar are implemented by . The first level of buttons are presented as group items that can be expanded or collapsed. In their expanded state they show the second level of buttons. The third level of buttons are presented as a floating menu.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QBalloonWindow
member.summary: QBalloonWindow is a QShapedWindow used for showing descriptive text for controls or areas of an application. Use the QBalloon component to show and hide the QBalloonWindow. Use the QBalloon component to configure a default QBalloonWindow or inherit from QBalloonWindow to create your custom window.
member.remarks:
The QBalloonWindow is managed by a component. The QBalloon will keep track of the text you want to display for your controls and when the QBalloonWindow is displayed its property will be set. To see the tags that can be used for this formatting, see the QMarkupText XML Reference.
To handle mouse events, implement an event handler for the several events like or .

member.summary: Returns a new rectangle that is inflated by this QPadding.
member.param: The rectangle to inflate.
Indicates if the rectangle must be inflated or deflated.

Indicates for which orientation it must be inflated When Horizontal the Left is added by the Left, Top by Top. When VerticalDown the Bottom is Added by the Left and the Left is added by the top (like rotated 90 degrees), etc

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPadding.InflateRectangleWithPadding(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Boolean,System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle)

member.summary: Returns a new rectangle that is inflated by this QPadding.
member.param: The rectangle to inflate.
Indicates if the rectangle must be inflated or deflated.

Defines whether the calculation must be for the horizontal orientation. When true the Left is added by the Left, Top by Top. When false the Bottom is Added by the Left and the Left is added by the top (like rotated 90 degrees)

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QPadding.InflateSizeWithPadding(System.Drawing.Size,System.Boolean,Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContentOrientation)
member.summary: Returns a new size that is inflated by this QPadding.
member.param: The size to inflate.

member.summary: Returns a new size that is inflated by this QPadding.
member.param: The size to inflate.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QMarkupLabel
member.summary: The QMarkupLabel is an advanced label that allows text to be formatted. For this purpose it implements a small subset of HTML. This should be written in legal XML. So when formatting, be sure to end empty tags like 'BR' with a slash like this is done in XML. Next to formatting you can make the QMarkupLabel interactive by using anchors.
member.remarks:
To use the QMarkupLabel you can set the or property. The property allows you to format your text. The property does not apply any format
To see the tags that can be used in QMarkupText, see the QMarkupText XML Reference.
You can configure the QMarkupLabel with the property. You can implement your own tags or add custom format to existing tags with the property. See (which is used internally) for additional information on implementing your own elements.
To handle mouse events, implement an event handler for the several events like or .

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QDockingWindow
member.summary:
This is a window that can be docked on the borders of a form, on other QDockingWindows or on a . They can be set to a tabbed layout and slide in and out on a QDockBar.
To use a QDockingWindow, create a new class and inherit from QDockingWindow. You can design a QDockingWindow like a normal form. Make sure to set the property before showing the Window. Use the method to dock the Window to its required location or on a . Use to undock the window.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QDockingWindow.SlideWindow(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If this window is docked to a it slides the window in or out. If slideIn is true the Window slides in, else it slides out. useMotion defines if motion should be used. If the property is false this parameter is ignored.

If UseMotion is true, the Window will slide using a motion when is set, else it will just expand or collapse.

member.name: T:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QContextMenu
member.summary:
A QContextMenu can be used to show context menus on controls. It is a that can be defined design-time. It uses a for the actual menu. Set the property to fill the menu with menu items. When a QContextMenu is used on a form, you can set the QContextMenu of that control to attach the menu to that control. Set the property to define the layout of the QContextMenu.
The QContextMenu inherits from , so it also contains a and a property.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QMainMenu.DockMainMenu(Qios.DevSuite.Components.QToolBarHost,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Docks the mainMenu on the specified host, row and index.
member.param: Specifies the toolBarHost where the mainMenu must be docked on.
Specifies the row where the mainMenu must be docked on. The first row has index 0.
Specifies what index the mainMenu must have on the row. The first toolBar has index 0.
member.remarks: When this method is called, the requestedPosition is resetted to 0. Use another overload to specify the requestedPosition.

member.name: M:Qios.DevSuite.Components.QMainMenu.DockMainMenu(Qios.DevSuite.Components.QToolBarHost,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Docks the mainMenu on the specified host, row and index and the requestedPosition.
member.param: Specifies the toolBarHost where the mainMenu must be docked on.
Specifies the row where the mainMenu must be docked on. The first row has index 0.
Specifies what index the mainMenu must have on the row. The first toolBar has index 0.
Specifies what the left (horizontal) or top (vertical) must be. The mainMenu will get that position when there are no other toolBars on that posisition.
